contentrichtext.text: {{one source|date=July 2008}} '''Mathias Feist''' (born 1961 in Germany) is a [[ChessBase]] and [[Fritz (chess)|Fritz]] [[programmer]]. He led the team that programmed [[Fritz (chess)|Deep Fritz]], which has been compared to [[Deep Blue (chess computer)|Deep Blue]].<ref Name="Reilly">{{cite book | last =Reilly | first =Edwin D. | authorlink = | coauthors = | title =Milestones in Computer Science and Information Technology | publisher =Greenwood Publishing Group | year =2003 | location = | pages =56 | url =http://books.google.com/books?id=JTYPKxug49IC&pg=PA56&dq=%22Mathias+Feist%22| doi = | isbn=1-57356-521-0 }}</ref> He was hired at the end of the 1980s to port the ChessBase program from [[Atari ST]] to [[DOS]]. He soon became an expert in the area of [[chess engine]]s and connecting them with the ChessBase and Fritz interfaces. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Feist, Mathias | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = German computer chess programmer | DATE OF BIRTH = 1961 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Feist, Mathias}} [[Category:German computer programmers]] [[Category:Computer chess people]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1961 births]] {{compu-bio-stub}} {{germany-chess-bio-stub}}
